title: [BUG] Loading .lottie file results in null SkiaSharp.Skottie.Animation
body: ### Description When loading a .lottie file, the resulting Animation is null. No exception is thrown, so it fails silently. Lottie file: https://app.lottiefiles.com/animation/5b206184-3c40-4a29-a6c4-0f62df06e4a8?channel=web&from=download&panel=download&source=public-animation ### Code The best way to share code for larger projects is a link to a GitHub repository: https://github.com/user/repo/tree/bug-123 But, you can also share a short block of code here: ```cs var animation = SkiaSharp.Skottie.Animation.Create(sourceFileAbsolute); ``` ### Expected Behavior A valid (not null) Animation instance should be returned. ### Actual Behavior A null animation instance is returned instead. ### Version of SkiaSharp 3.116.0 (Current) ### Last Known Good Version of SkiaSharp Other (Please indicate in the description) ### IDE / Editor Visual Studio (Windows) ### Platform / Operating System Windows ### Platform / Operating System Version Windows 11 ### Devices Windows 11 Desktop ### Relevant Screenshots ### Relevant Log Output ```shell ``` ### Code of Conduct - [x] I agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct

comments.author: github-actions[bot]
comments.body:
**Triage Summary**  

Labels will be applied to indicate the area related to SkiaSharp, the operating system involved (Windows Classic), and the reliability aspect of the issue due to a silent failure.

This issue does not appear to be a regression, as there is no prior functionality indicated for this specific broken case.

Additional remarks:
* The issue specifically involves loading a .lottie file with SkiaSharp, highlighting a null object issue without direct labels available for SkiaSharp.

<details>
<summary>Detailed Summary and Actions</summary>

Summary of the triage:

- The issue pertains to loading a .lottie file, which is linked to SkiaSharp.
- It occurs on the Windows platform, particularly noted on Windows 11 and Visual Studio.
- There is an indication of a silent failure returning a null object instead of a valid Animation instance, reflecting an unexpected behavior in the application.

Summary of the actions that will be performed:

| Action       | Item                    | Description                                                                                      |
| :----------- | :---------------------- | :----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Apply Label  | area/SkiaSharp         | The issue pertains to loading a .lottie file, directly related to the C# binding of SkiaSharp. |
| Apply Label  | os/Windows-Classic     | The issue specifies that it is occurring on the Windows platform, particularly Windows 11.      |
| Apply Label  | tenet/reliability      | The issue involves a silent failure, returning a null object instead of a valid Animation.      |

</details>

_This entire triage process was automated by AI and mistakes may have been made. Please let us know so we can continue to improve._
